intro: Monnina involuta, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous annual plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
